alert.note: Alert for De Kalb (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 9:25PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, in north central Illinois, De Kalb. In northeast Illinois, Kane. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 924 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with additional thunderstorms moving through the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible, which may worsen flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elgin, Bartlett, Carpentersville, St. Charles, Algonquin, West Chicago, Huntley, Sycamore, Campton Hills, Genoa, South Elgin, Pingree Grove, Gilberts, West Dundee, Hampshire, Barrington Hills, Sleepy Hollow, East Dundee, Wayne and Valley View. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, farmland, roadways, and and other low lying areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
